DBOBC(jjrotn, mass, m, par, args)[source]¶

The diagonal BOB correction

Parameters

  • jjrotn (float) – parameter with value equal to J(J+1)

  • mass (float) – the mass value

  • m (float) – multiplier for the R-dependent functions

  • par (int) – specify e- or f-symmetry

  • args (list) – the electronic and rotational quantum numbers

Returns

the computed correction

Return type

array

lj_interaction(jjrotn, mass, m, par, args)[source]¶
Calculate the matrix elements of LJ operator which are:

<State1| LJ |State1> = <State1| LJ |State2> =

with selection rules:

Parameters

  • jjrotn (float) – parameter with value equal to J(J+1)

  • mass (float) – the mass value

  • m (float) – multiplier for the R-dependent functions

  • par (int) – specify e- or f-symmetry

  • args (list) – the electronic and rotational quantum numbers

Returns

the computed matrix elements

Return type

array

rule_lj_parity(args)[source]¶

This interaction is allowed only between Sigma-Pi or Sigma-Sigma states with even multiplicity with Lambda <= 1 and abs(Omega) = 0.5

sj_interaction(jjrotn, mass, m, par, args)[source]¶
Calculate the matrix elements of SJ operator which are:

<State1| SJ |State1> = <State1| SJ |State2> =

with selection rules:

Parameters

  • jjrotn (float) – parameter with value equal to J(J+1)

  • mass (float) – the mass value

  • m (float) – multiplier for the R-dependent functions

  • par (int) – specify e- or f-symmetry

  • args (list) – the electronic and rotational quantum numbers

Returns

the computed matrix elements

Return type

array

sj_parity_interaction(jjrotn, mass, m, par, args)[source]¶

only between Sigma states

spin_electornic_interaction(jjrotn, mass, m, par, args)[source]¶
Calculate the matrix elements of SL operator which are:

<State1| SL |State1> = <State1| SL |State2> =

with selection rules:

Parameters

  • jjrotn (float) – parameter with value equal to J(J+1)

  • mass (float) – the mass value

  • m (float) – multiplier for the R-dependent functions

  • par (int) – specify e- or f-symmetry

  • args (list) – the electronic and rotational quantum numbers

Returns

the computed matrix elements

Return type

array

spin_orbit_interaction(jjrotn, mass, m, par, args)[source]¶
Calculate diagonal and off-diagonal Spin-Orbit matrix element

<State1| SO |State1> = multiplier * A(R) <State1| SO |State2> = multiplier * alpha(R)

with selection rules:

Parameters

  • jjrotn (float) – parameter with value equal to J(J+1)

  • mass (float) – the mass value

  • m (float) – multiplier for the R-dependent functions

  • par (int) – specify e- or f-symmetry

  • args (list) – the electronic and rotational quantum numbers

Returns

the computed matrix elements

Return type

array
